comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: General Jose Santos Zelaya (white mustache), liberal former President (1893-1909) of Nicaragua, roused from sleep and arrested in the middle of the night in New York City by U. S. Marshall Henkel on a charge of murder. He was incarcerated in The Tombs jail, pursuant to an extradition treaty with the government of Nicaragua. Zelaya had been tried and convicted in absentia of murder, by the regime of his successors in Nicaragua. [Zelaya died in 1919, in New York City.] New York Times story of Zelaya's arrest, November 28, 1913: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=940DE7D61E3BE633A...

comment._content: I wish life was still like this
